THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON
06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE
FOLLOWING :

[BlSene
2020/KER/258
Crl.M.C.No.9258 of 2019 4
Cri.M.C. No.9258 of 2019
ORDER

This is a proceedings instituted under Section 482 of
the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure A2 final
report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto, now
pending as C.C.No.583 of 2015 on the files of the Court of the
Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il, Kanjirappally against the
petitioners.

2. The petitioners are accused Nos.1 to 12 in the
said case. The case was one instituted at the instance of
respondents 1 and 2 under Sections 143, 149, 427, 447 and
506 (ii) of the Indian Penal Code.

3. It is seen that the petitioners and respondents 1
and 2 have settled their disputes, and affidavits to that effect
have been filed by respondents 1 and 2 as Annexure A3 series
to the effect that they do not intend to pursue the matter
further.

4. The learned counsel for respondents 1 and 2
affirms that Annexure A3 series affidavits are affidavits sworn

Pelee aed
_
Skat
2020/KER/258
Crl.M.C.No.9258 of 2019 5
to by respondents 1 and 2, and submits that they have no
objection in granting the relief sought for by the petitioners.

5. In the light of the decisions of the Apex Court in
Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303 and
Narinder singh v. State of Punjab, (2014) 6 SCC 466, | am
of the view that this is an appropriate case where this court has
to invoke the jurisdiction under Section 482 of the Code of
Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings against the
petitioners.

In the result, the Crl.M.C. Is allowed and Annexure A2
final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto against
the petitioners, pending as C.C.No.583 of 2015 on the files of
the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il,
Kanjirappally are quashed
